item.title: Ongoing issue with household rubbish bags being broken and emptied onto street by crows and foxes, 6th August
item.description:
Weekly issue with the bin bags residents put on street for waste collection overnight are torn open by crows and foxes which spread rubbish including food and tampons everywhere. Can the council provide this street with sealed wheelie bins?

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Bridport Place, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dumped rubbish on the green again., 6th August
item.description:
Rubbish dumped again on the green between 176-206 Kingsground. It is a broken down sofa and general waste, it appeared overnight as usual and it stinks. It looks as if has been dragged from the opposite side of the road, by the amount of debris on the pavement. Please can you get it cleared quickly as the smell from it is awful. Thank you.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 174,176, Kingsground, Middle Park, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Smelly Hackney Compost bin - Texryte House, 6th August
item.description:

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Southgate Road, Hackney, London

item.title: Cigarette butts, bottles, wrappers everywhere, 6th August
item.description:
I have emailed you last week. You said you sent a contractor out and he couldn't see the problem? How can this be? All the way up Wisley Road from number 40 to 46 and opposite 57 etc Its an absolute disgrace on this road. I do not believe a contractor could of been looking at Wisley Road
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 48, Wisley Road, St Paul's Cray, London
Report on FixMyStreet
